article.headline: Lafayette 69, Drexel 68
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Justin DeBerry keyed a second half comeback for Lafayette as the Leopards defeated the Drexel Dragons 69-68 on Tuesday night. DeBerry led Lafayette with 17 points. Sean Knitter and Rob Dill also hit double figures for the Leopards. Up by one point early on, Drexel (1-2) went on a 19-7 run to take a 24-11 lead at the midway point of the first half. Lafayette (3-1) pulled to within four, but the Dragons took a 38-31 lead into the locker room. Chipping away at the Drexel lead, Lafayette took the lead on a 3-pointer by DeBerry that put the Leopards ahead 59-56 with just under six minutes left in the game. Trailing 69-68, Drexel had three chances to hit the game winning shot but were unable to convert as Lafayette's Jamie Hughes blocked a Jeremiah King shot with less than two seconds left, allowing the Leopards to escape with the victory. Sean Brooks had a career game for Drexel. The junior notched his first collegiate double-double with 23 points and 16 rebounds while collecting two blocks, all personal bests.
